item.title: Cryptographers unearth vulnerabilities in Telegram's encryption protocol - CyberScoop
item.description: An international team of computer scientists reported on Friday that they found four cryptographic vulnerabilities in the popular encrypted message app Telegram. The weaknesses range â€œfrom technically trivial and easy to exploit to more advanced and of theoretical interest,â€ according to the security analysis. But ultimately they prove that the four key issues â€œcould be done better, more securely and in a more trustworthy manner with a standard approach to cryptography,â€ said ETH Zurich Professor Kenny Paterson, who was part of the team that uncovered the flaw. The most significant of the vulnerabilities the researchers uncovered is what they called the â€œcrime-pizzaâ€ vulnerability. In it, an attacker could alter the order of messages coming from a client to a cloud server that Telegram operates. â€œFor example, if the order of the messages in the sequence â€˜I say â€œyesâ€ toâ€™, â€˜pizzaâ€™, â€˜I say â€œnoâ€ toâ€™, â€œcrimeâ€ was altered then it would [â€¦]

item.title: My progress on real RISC-V hardware - #31 by X512 - OS - Haiku Community
Looking Glass - Looking Glass
item.description: Unlike network based streaming applications, Looking Glass does not use any form of compression or color space conversion, all frames are transferred to the viewer (client application) in 32-bit RGBA without any transformations or modifications. This is possible through the use of a shared memory segment which enables extremely high throughput low latency guest to host communication.
